security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only guidance text for creating Claude skills. No executable code, no network calls, no file operations beyond reading documentation. Safe for publication.

content.user_title: Create Claude skills with best practices
content.value_statement: Creating Claude skills from scratch can be confusing without proper guidance. This skill provides a structured framework for skill development including templates, validation checklists, and proven patterns for modular skill design.
actual_capabilities: Provides step-by-step guide for creating new Claude skills
Defines skill structure with required files and optional resources
Includes validation checklist for skill quality assurance
Explains progressive disclosure patterns for content organization
Documents frontmatter requirements and markdown body structure
limitations: Does not execute code or create files automatically
Does not provide executable script templates
Does not validate skill packages in the environment
Does not integrate with external build systems

use_cases.title: Build new skills
use_cases.description: Create new Claude skills from scratch using structured guidance and templates.

use_cases.title: Improve existing skills
use_cases.description: Refactor and enhance existing skills with best practices for modularity.

use_cases.title: Structure skill documentation
use_cases.description: Organize skill content using progressive disclosure patterns effectively.

prompt_templates.title: Create new skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Claude skill called [skill-name] that [description of what it does]. Show me the full SKILL.md structure with frontmatter and body.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my skill at [path] against the validation checklist. What improvements are needed?

prompt_templates.title: Add resources
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to add bundled resources to my skill. Show me how to organize scripts/, references/, and assets/ directories.

prompt_templates.title: Refactor skill
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill is too long. Help me apply progressive disclosure patterns to reorganize the content into levels.

output_examples.input: Help me create a new skill for PDF processing
output: Structure: SKILL.md with YAML frontmatter + markdown body
Resources: scripts/ for PDF tools, references/ for API docs
Progressive disclosure: Quick start in SKILL.md, details in references/

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md concise - Claude already has strong reasoning, add only essential context.
Use progressive disclosure - basic usage in SKILL.md, advanced details in references/.
Define clear degrees of freedom - text for flexible tasks, scripts for sensitive operations.
Always include 'when to use' in the description to trigger the skill appropriately.
anti_patterns: Including README.md, INSTALLATION_GUIDE.md, or CHANGELOG.md - skills are for AI agents, not users.
Exceeding 500 lines in SKILL.md - violates context window efficiency principles.
Deep reference directory nesting - keep references/ structure to one level.
Missing 'when to use' context in description - makes skill triggering unreliable.

faq.question: What tools can a skill use?
faq.answer: Skills can use Read, Glob, Grep, Edit, Write, and Bash tools. Define allowed-tools in frontmatter.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for SKILL.md?
faq.description: Keep SKILL.md under 500 lines for optimal context efficiency. Move details to references/.

faq.question: How do I organize bundled resources?
faq.answer: Use scripts/ for code, references/ for docs, assets/ for templates and media. Reference them in SKILL.md.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only reads documentation. It does not access files, network, or execute code on your system.

faq.question: Why is my skill not triggering?
faq.answer: Ensure the description includes clear 'when to use' context. Match user requests to trigger conditions.

faq.question: How is this different from custom instructions?
faq.answer: Skills are modular packages for specific workflows. Custom instructions are global. Skills can be shared and imported.
